reviews.text:
It's few time now that I am going back to this lovely, cozy caf√®. Incredible and unusual decor, vintage items everywhere, it's like walking in a little museum. Clean, welcoming, friendly, quiet, great music selection and one of the best coffee I have ever had.
Spend a bit of time talking with the owners, they are great people and they organise lots of events. They know their food and their drinks too!!! A pearl in the neighborhood üòç

What an amazing place this is - a real hidden gem! I highly recommend their pickle salad with poached egg, their homemade lemonade and their iced coffee! Also great place to work from and very cool decorations and vibe throughout! Definitely pop by if you're in the area!

Great cafe/bar with a focus on quality. My second time coming here and the food is exquisite. I definitely recommend the mexican breakfast or the chilli scramble eggs.I am looking forward to coming back for one of the jazz nights.
Fab hidden gem near Sydenham and Forest Hill. Great atmosphere and wine. Also great lunch options I've enjoyed on a few occasions.

You know when you have been searching for something and places just dont seem to tick all the boxes, well...I found my place. Close to home and secretive enough for me. As much as I want to see this place busy, i love how it does have its serenity.

I found "The Moustache" by chance and so happy I did of course.

on entry you'll step in and be like "aaaah", it instantly feels cosy, has a rustic theme to it with odd chair sets and tables, bare wood flooring and exposed brick work.

As this place is owned by an Artist, you will see art work which is for sale on the walls.

Music played in the background is a perfect volume and old school jazz music. It feels a bit like a step back in time when youre hear. I find it hard to leave when I have the intention to stay just for a short while...oh well.

Coffee is well made with a good coffee bean, not the fruity stuff but good proper coffee.

homemade cakes, which I found to die for! is it wierd I had it with a beer.
yes they serve beer, bottled, canned (Brixton Brewery/Ignition Brewery) and on tap too (Electric IPA).
As well as Prosecco, wine, red or white and gin.

Food menu is seriously tasty. Might sound the same as options you get in other places but its done really well.
Theres a morning to afternoon menu and then one for the evening.

Ive had poached eggs with chorizo slices, on sourdough toast and smashed avacado. Presentation was on point and very artistic, portion size is great and and tastes all amazing! not exaggerating.

Also had a butternut squash and ginger soup thats served with toast.
Carrot cake!!!! too good and finished my afternoon off with a cheeseboard for two hahaha but it was just for me.

This cheese board is like no other. Homemade crackers, chilli oil, olives, garnishing, chorizo, cheese and a few interesting dips to really spoil you.

see photos for proof. You'll enjoy your experience!

They have a baby buggy parking railing outside, play room downstairs for kids, unisex toilet.

Once a month they have a film club on with projector screen, havent tried it myself yet but will do.

Hope you enjoy it as much as I have. Definitely a returning customer!!!!

you wil get lost with time in here if you have a book.
